meanings.definition: A person who is not skilled in or does not study mathematics.
meanings.sent1: Many nonmathematicians struggle with understanding complex mathematical concepts.
meanings.sent2: The math competition was only open to nonmathematicians.
meanings.sent3: Why did the nonmathematicians refuse to divide the bill at the restaurant? Because they couldn't calculate the tip!
meanings.sent4: In a world full of numbers, nonmathematicians are like artists painting with words.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was divided into two groups: mathematicians and nonmathematicians, each with their own unique way of thinking.

meanings.definition: Those who are not experts in mathematics.
meanings.sent1: The math tutor specialized in helping nonmathematicians improve their skills.
meanings.sent2: The conference aimed to make math more accessible to nonmathematicians.
meanings.sent3: Why did the nonmathematicians bring a calculator to the party? In case they needed to 'multiply' the fun!
meanings.sent4: While mathematicians see equations, nonmathematicians see puzzles waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The math club welcomed both mathematicians and nonmathematicians, fostering a sense of community among all.
